result.markdown:
---
title: "SWIID Version 9.7 is available!"
author: Frederick Solt
date: '2024-09-14'
categories:
  - update
  - swiid
description: "Hi everyone! Version 9.7 of the SWIID is now available! This new release adds to its source data nearly two thousand new Ginis since version 9.6..."
---

::: {.cell}

:::


Hi everyone! Version 9.7 of the SWIID is [now available](/swiid/swiid_downloads/)! This new release:

-   adds to [its source data](https://github.com/fsolt/swiid/blob/master/data/swiid_source.csv) 1825 new Ginis since version 9.6, including newly available LIS data on [Austria, Brazil, Colombia, Denmark, Germany, Ireland, the Netherlands, Slovakia, South Korea, Spain, Peru, Romania, Russia and the United States](https://www.lisdatacenter.org/news-and-events/2024-spring-data-splash/) and on [Colombia (again!), France, Luxembourg, and Serbia](https://www.lisdatacenter.org/news-and-events/2024-summer-data-splash/); and

-   includes estimates of market and disposable income inequality for 206 more country-years than version 9.6.


::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/plot-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](index_files/figure-html/highest-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::


For more details, you can check out the all the R and Stan code used to generate the estimates [in the SWIID GitHub repository](https://github.com/fsolt/swiid). As always, I encourage users of the SWIID to [email me](mailto:frederick-solt@uiowa.edu) with their comments, questions, and suggestions.
